nl.inl.blacklab.index.complex

Class ComplexFieldUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.index.complex.ComplexFieldUtil

  • public class ComplexFieldUtil
extends Object
    Some utility functions for dealing with complex field names.

      • setFieldNameSeparators

        public static void setFieldNameSeparators(boolean avoidSpecialChars)
        Set what field name separators to use.
        Parameters:
        avoidSpecialChars - if true, use only standard identifier characters for the separators. If false, use special chars %, @, #.

      • bookkeepingField

        public static String bookkeepingField(String fieldName,
                                      String propName,
                                      String bookkeepName)
        Construct a complex field bookkeeping subfield name.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the base field name
        propName - the property name, or null if this is bookkeeping for the whole complex field
        bookkeepName - name of the bookkeeping value
        Returns:
        the combined complex field name

      • bookkeepingField

        public static String bookkeepingField(String fieldName,
                                      String bookkeepName)
        Construct a complex field bookkeeping subfield name.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the base field name
        bookkeepName - name of the bookkeeping value
        Returns:
        the combined complex field name

      • propertyField

        public static String propertyField(String fieldName,
                                   String propName,
                                   String altName)
        Construct a complex field property name.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the base field name
        propName - the property name
        altName - the alternative name
        Returns:
        the combined complex field name

      • propertyField

        public static String propertyField(String fieldName,
                                   String propName)
        Construct a complex field property name.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the base field name
        propName - the property name
        Returns:
        the combined complex field name

      • propertyAlternative

        public static String propertyAlternative(String fieldPropName,
                                         String altName)
        Construct a property alternative name from a field property name
        Parameters:
        fieldPropName - the field property name
        altName - the alternative name
        Returns:
        the field property alternative name

      • getNameComponents

        public static String[] getNameComponents(String luceneFieldName)
        Gets the different components of a complex field property (alternative) name.
        Parameters:
        luceneFieldName - the Lucene index field name, with possibly a property and/or alternative added
        Returns:
        an array of size 1-4, containing the field name, and optionally the property name, alternative name and bookkeeping field name. Property name may be null if this is a main bookkeeping field. Alternative name may be null if this is a bookkeeping field or if it indicates the main property (not an alternative).

      • getBaseName

        public static String getBaseName(String luceneFieldName)
        Gets the base complex field name from a Lucene index field name. So "contents" and "contents%pos" would both yield "contents".
        Parameters:
        luceneFieldName - the Lucene index field name, with possibly a property added
        Returns:
        the base complex field name

      • isAlternative

        public static boolean isAlternative(String fieldPropAltName,
                                    String altName)
        Checks if the given fieldName actually points to an alternative property (for example, a case-sensitive version of a property). Example: the fieldName "contents%lemma@s" indicates the "s" alternative of the "lemma" property of the "contents" complex field.
        Parameters:
        fieldPropAltName - the full fieldname, possibly including a property and/or alternative
        altName - the alternative to test for
        Returns:
        true if the fieldName indicates the specified alternative

      • mainPropertyField

        public static String mainPropertyField(IndexStructure structure,
                                       String fieldName)

      • mainPropertyOffsetsField

        public static String mainPropertyOffsetsField(IndexStructure structure,
                                              String fieldName)

      • getDefaultMainPropName

        public static String getDefaultMainPropName()

      • getDefaultMainAlternativeName

        public static String getDefaultMainAlternativeName()

      • avoidSpecialCharsInFieldNames

        public static boolean avoidSpecialCharsInFieldNames()
        Are we using the naming scheme with longer separation codes with no special characters in them?
        Returns:
        true if we are, false if not

      • isCaseSensitive

        public static boolean isCaseSensitive(String fieldPropAltName)
        Does this Lucene field name refer to a case-sensitive alternative? Case-sensitive alternatives are "s" (case- and diacritics-sensitive) and "di" (diacritics-insensitive but case-sensitive).
        Parameters:
        fieldPropAltName - Lucene field name including property and alt name
        Returns:
        true if the field name refers to a case-sensitive alternative

      • isDiacriticsSensitive

        public static boolean isDiacriticsSensitive(String fieldPropAltName)
        Does this Lucene field name refer to a diacritics-sensitive alternative? Diacritics-sensitive alternatives are "s" (case- and diacritics-sensitive) and "ci" (case-insensitive but diacritics-sensitive).
        Parameters:
        fieldPropAltName - Lucene field name including property and alt name
        Returns:
        true if the field name refers to a diacritics-sensitive alternative

      • isValidXmlElementName

        public static boolean isValidXmlElementName(String name)
        Is the specified name a valid XML element name? Generally, field and property names should be valid XML element names, so we don't have to sanitize them when generating output XML.
        Parameters:
        name - name to check
        Returns:
        true iff it's a valid XML element name
